authorization_url.description: URL used to generate the auth code used during token generation.

client_id.description: Client ID used to authenticate when generating a token for authenticating with the remote SCIM service.

client_secret.description: Secret used to authenticate when generating a token for authenticating with the remove SCIM service.

deactivate_on_delete.description: If false, we propagate DELETE requests to the target application for SCIM resources. If true, we only set `active` to false on the SCIM resource. This is useful because some targets do not support DELETE operations.

enabled.description: Whether SCIM provisioning is turned on for this application.

idp_uid.description: The UID of the IdP to use as the source for SCIM resources to provision to this application.

mappings.description: A list of mappings to apply to SCIM resources before provisioning them in this application. These can transform or filter the resources to be provisioned.

items.description: Transformations and filters applied to resources before they are provisioned in the remote SCIM service.

enabled.description: Whether or not this mapping is enabled.

filter.description: A [SCIM filter expression](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7644#section-3.4.2.2) that matches resources that should be provisioned to this application.

operations.description: Whether or not this mapping applies to creates, updates, or deletes.

create.description: Whether or not this mapping applies to create (POST) operations.

delete.description: Whether or not this mapping applies to DELETE operations.

update.description: Whether or not this mapping applies to update (PATCH/PUT) operations.

schema.description: Which SCIM resource type this mapping applies to.

transform_jsonata.description: A [JSONata](https://jsonata.org/) expression that transforms the resource before provisioning it in the application.

remote_uri.description: The base URI for the application's SCIM-compatible API.

allowed_idps.description: The identity providers your users can select when connecting to this application. Defaults to all IdPs configured in your account.

items.description: The identity providers selected for application.

app_launcher_visible.description: Displays the application in the App Launcher.

auto_redirect_to_identity.description: When set to `true`, users skip the identity provider selection step during login. You must specify only one identity provider in allowed_idps.

allow_credentials.description: When set to `true`, includes credentials (cookies, authorization headers, or TLS client certificates) with requests.

max_age.description: The maximum number of seconds the results of a preflight request can be cached.

custom_deny_message.description: The custom error message shown to a user when they are denied access to the application.

custom_deny_url.description: The custom URL a user is redirected to when they are denied access to the application.

domain.description: The domain and path that Access will secure.

enable_binding_cookie.description: Enables the binding cookie, which increases security against compromised authorization tokens and CSRF attacks.

http_only_cookie_attribute.description: Enables the HttpOnly cookie attribute, which increases security against XSS attacks.

logo_url.description: The image URL for the logo shown in the App Launcher dashboard.

options_preflight_bypass.description: Allows options preflight requests to bypass Access authentication and go directly to the origin. Cannot turn on if cors_headers is set.

same_site_cookie_attribute.description: Sets the SameSite cookie setting, which provides increased security against CSRF attacks.

service_auth_401_redirect.description: Returns a 401 status code when the request is blocked by a Service Auth policy.

session_duration.description: The amount of time that tokens issued for this application will be valid. Must be in the format `300ms` or `2h45m`. Valid time units are: ns, us (or Âµs), ms, s, m, h.

deactivate_on_delete.description: If false, we propagate DELETE requests to the target application for SCIM resources. If true, we only set `active` to false on the SCIM resource. This is useful because some targets do not support DELETE operations.

enabled.description: Whether SCIM provisioning is turned on for this application.

idp_uid.description: The UID of the IdP to use as the source for SCIM resources to provision to this application.

mappings.description: A list of mappings to apply to SCIM resources before provisioning them in this application. These can transform or filter the resources to be provisioned.

items.description: Transformations and filters applied to resources before they are provisioned in the remote SCIM service.

enabled.description: Whether or not this mapping is enabled.

filter.description: A [SCIM filter expression](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7644#section-3.4.2.2) that matches resources that should be provisioned to this application.

operations.description: Whether or not this mapping applies to creates, updates, or deletes.

create.description: Whether or not this mapping applies to create (POST) operations.

delete.description: Whether or not this mapping applies to DELETE operations.

update.description: Whether or not this mapping applies to update (PATCH/PUT) operations.

schema.description: Which SCIM resource type this mapping applies to.

transform_jsonata.description: A [JSONata](https://jsonata.org/) expression that transforms the resource before provisioning it in the application.

remote_uri.description: The base URI for the application's SCIM-compatible API.

allowed_idps.description: The identity providers your users can select when connecting to this application. Defaults to all IdPs configured in your account.

items.description: The identity providers selected for application.

app_launcher_visible.description: Displays the application in the App Launcher.

auto_redirect_to_identity.description: When set to `true`, users skip the identity provider selection step during login. You must specify only one identity provider in allowed_idps.

allow_credentials.description: When set to `true`, includes credentials (cookies, authorization headers, or TLS client certificates) with requests.

max_age.description: The maximum number of seconds the results of a preflight request can be cached.

custom_deny_message.description: The custom error message shown to a user when they are denied access to the application.

custom_deny_url.description: The custom URL a user is redirected to when they are denied access to the application.

domain.description: The domain and path that Access will secure.

enable_binding_cookie.description: Enables the binding cookie, which increases security against compromised authorization tokens and CSRF attacks.

http_only_cookie_attribute.description: Enables the HttpOnly cookie attribute, which increases security against XSS attacks.

logo_url.description: The image URL for the logo shown in the App Launcher dashboard.

options_preflight_bypass.description: Allows options preflight requests to bypass Access authentication and go directly to the origin. Cannot turn on if cors_headers is set.

same_site_cookie_attribute.description: Sets the SameSite cookie setting, which provides increased security against CSRF attacks.

service_auth_401_redirect.description: Returns a 401 status code when the request is blocked by a Service Auth policy.

session_duration.description: The amount of time that tokens issued for this application will be valid. Must be in the format `300ms` or `2h45m`. Valid time units are: ns, us (or Âµs), ms, s, m, h.

scim_config.description: Configuration for provisioning to this application via SCIM. This is currently in closed beta.

enabled.description: Whether SCIM provisioning is turned on for this application.

idp_uid.description: The UID of the IdP to use as the source for SCIM resources to provision to this application.

mappings.description: A list of mappings to apply to SCIM resources before provisioning them in this application. These can transform or filter the resources to be provisioned.

items.description: Transformations and filters applied to resources before they are provisioned in the remote SCIM service.

enabled.description: Whether or not this mapping is enabled.

filter.description: A [SCIM filter expression](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7644#section-3.4.2.2) that matches resources that should be provisioned to this application.

operations.description: Whether or not this mapping applies to creates, updates, or deletes.

create.description: Whether or not this mapping applies to create (POST) operations.

delete.description: Whether or not this mapping applies to DELETE operations.

update.description: Whether or not this mapping applies to update (PATCH/PUT) operations.

schema.description: Which SCIM resource type this mapping applies to.

transform_jsonata.description: A [JSONata](https://jsonata.org/) expression that transforms the resource before provisioning it in the application.

remote_uri.description: The base URI for the application's SCIM-compatible API.

allowed_idps.description: The identity providers your users can select when connecting to this application. Defaults to all IdPs configured in your account.

items.description: The identity providers selected for application.

app_launcher_visible.description: Displays the application in the App Launcher.

auto_redirect_to_identity.description: When set to `true`, users skip the identity provider selection step during login. You must specify only one identity provider in allowed_idps.

allow_credentials.description: When set to `true`, includes credentials (cookies, authorization headers, or TLS client certificates) with requests.

max_age.description: The maximum number of seconds the results of a preflight request can be cached.

custom_deny_message.description: The custom error message shown to a user when they are denied access to the application.

custom_deny_url.description: The custom URL a user is redirected to when they are denied access to the application.

domain.description: The domain and path that Access will secure.

enable_binding_cookie.description: Enables the binding cookie, which increases security against compromised authorization tokens and CSRF attacks.

http_only_cookie_attribute.description: Enables the HttpOnly cookie attribute, which increases security against XSS attacks.

logo_url.description: The image URL for the logo shown in the App Launcher dashboard.

options_preflight_bypass.description: Allows options preflight requests to bypass Access authentication and go directly to the origin. Cannot turn on if cors_headers is set.

same_site_cookie_attribute.description: Sets the SameSite cookie setting, which provides increased security against CSRF attacks.

service_auth_401_redirect.description: Returns a 401 status code when the request is blocked by a Service Auth policy.

session_duration.description: The amount of time that tokens issued for this application will be valid. Must be in the format `300ms` or `2h45m`. Valid time units are: ns, us (or Âµs), ms, s, m, h.

scim_config.description: Configuration for provisioning to this application via SCIM. This is currently in closed beta.

public_key.description: The Access public certificate that will be used to verify your identity.

sp_entity_id.description: A globally unique name for an identity or service provider.

sso_endpoint.description: The endpoint where your SaaS application will send login requests.

access_token_lifetime.description: The lifetime of the OIDC Access Token after creation. Valid units are m,h. Must be greater than or equal to 1m and less than or equal to 24h.

allow_pkce_without_client_secret.description: If client secret should be required on the token endpoint when authorization_code_with_pkce grant is used.

app_launcher_url.description: The URL where this applications tile redirects users

auth_type.description: Identifier of the authentication protocol used for the saas app. Required for OIDC.

client_id.description: The application client id

client_secret.description: The application client secret, only returned on POST request.

required.description: If the claim is required when building an OIDC token.

name.description: The name of the IdP claim.

name_by_idp.description: A mapping from IdP ID to claim name.

grant_types.description: The OIDC flows supported by this application

group_filter_regex.description: A regex to filter Cloudflare groups returned in ID token and userinfo endpoint.

return_access_token_from_authorization_e.description: If an Access Token should be returned from the OIDC Authorization endpoint

return_id_token_from_authorization_endpo.description: If an ID Token should be returned from the OIDC Authorization endpoint

public_key.description: The Access public certificate that will be used to verify your identity.

redirect_uris.description: The permitted URL's for Cloudflare to return Authorization codes and Access/ID tokens

lifetime.description: How long a refresh token will be valid for after creation. Valid units are m,h,d. Must be longer than 1m.

scopes.description: Define the user information shared with access, "offline_access" scope will be automatically enabled if refresh tokens are enabled

scim_config.description: Configuration for provisioning to this application via SCIM. This is currently in closed beta.

oneOf.description: Attributes for configuring HTTP Basic authentication scheme for SCIM provisioning to an application.

password.description: Password used to authenticate with the remote SCIM service.

scheme.description: The authentication scheme to use when making SCIM requests to this application.

user.description: User name used to authenticate with the remote SCIM service.

oneOf.title: HTTP Basic

scheme.description: The authentication scheme to use when making SCIM requests to this application.

token.description: Token used to authenticate with the remote SCIM service.

oneOf.title: OAuth Bearer Token

oneOf.description: Attributes for configuring OAuth 2 authentication scheme for SCIM provisioning to an application.

authorization_url.description: URL used to generate the auth code used during token generation.

client_id.description: Client ID used to authenticate when generating a token for authenticating with the remote SCIM service.

client_secret.description: Secret used to authenticate when generating a token for authenticating with the remove SCIM service.

scheme.description: The authentication scheme to use when making SCIM requests to this application.

scopes.description: The authorization scopes to request when generating the token used to authenticate with the remove SCIM service.

token_url.description: URL used to generate the token used to authenticate with the remote SCIM service.

deactivate_on_delete.description: If false, we propagate DELETE requests to the target application for SCIM resources. If true, we only set `active` to false on the SCIM resource. This is useful because some targets do not support DELETE operations.

enabled.description: Whether SCIM provisioning is turned on for this application.

idp_uid.description: The UID of the IdP to use as the source for SCIM resources to provision to this application.

mappings.description: A list of mappings to apply to SCIM resources before provisioning them in this application. These can transform or filter the resources to be provisioned.

items.description: Transformations and filters applied to resources before they are provisioned in the remote SCIM service.

enabled.description: Whether or not this mapping is enabled.

filter.description: A [SCIM filter expression](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7644#section-3.4.2.2) that matches resources that should be provisioned to this application.

operations.description: Whether or not this mapping applies to creates, updates, or deletes.

create.description: Whether or not this mapping applies to create (POST) operations.

delete.description: Whether or not this mapping applies to DELETE operations.

update.description: Whether or not this mapping applies to update (PATCH/PUT) operations.

schema.description: Which SCIM resource type this mapping applies to.

transform_jsonata.description: A [JSONata](https://jsonata.org/) expression that transforms the resource before provisioning it in the application.

remote_uri.description: The base URI for the application's SCIM-compatible API.

allowed_idps.description: The identity providers your users can select when connecting to this application. Defaults to all IdPs configured in your account.

items.description: The identity providers selected for application.

app_launcher_visible.description: Displays the application in the App Launcher.

auto_redirect_to_identity.description: When set to `true`, users skip the identity provider selection step during login. You must specify only one identity provider in allowed_idps.

allow_credentials.description: When set to `true`, includes credentials (cookies, authorization headers, or TLS client certificates) with requests.

max_age.description: The maximum number of seconds the results of a preflight request can be cached.

custom_deny_message.description: The custom error message shown to a user when they are denied access to the application.

custom_deny_url.description: The custom URL a user is redirected to when they are denied access to the application.

domain.description: The domain and path that Access will secure.

enable_binding_cookie.description: Enables the binding cookie, which increases security against compromised authorization tokens and CSRF attacks.

http_only_cookie_attribute.description: Enables the HttpOnly cookie attribute, which increases security against XSS attacks.

logo_url.description: The image URL for the logo shown in the App Launcher dashboard.

options_preflight_bypass.description: Allows options preflight requests to bypass Access authentication and go directly to the origin. Cannot turn on if cors_headers is set.

same_site_cookie_attribute.description: Sets the SameSite cookie setting, which provides increased security against CSRF attacks.

service_auth_401_redirect.description: Returns a 401 status code when the request is blocked by a Service Auth policy.

session_duration.description: The amount of time that tokens issued for this application will be valid. Must be in the format `300ms` or `2h45m`. Valid time units are: ns, us (or Âµs), ms, s, m, h.

token_url.description: URL used to generate the token used to authenticate with the remote SCIM service.

deactivate_on_delete.description: If false, we propagate DELETE requests to the target application for SCIM resources. If true, we only set `active` to false on the SCIM resource. This is useful because some targets do not support DELETE operations.

enabled.description: Whether SCIM provisioning is turned on for this application.

idp_uid.description: The UID of the IdP to use as the source for SCIM resources to provision to this application.

mappings.description: A list of mappings to apply to SCIM resources before provisioning them in this application. These can transform or filter the resources to be provisioned.

items.description: Transformations and filters applied to resources before they are provisioned in the remote SCIM service.

enabled.description: Whether or not this mapping is enabled.

filter.description: A [SCIM filter expression](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7644#section-3.4.2.2) that matches resources that should be provisioned to this application.

operations.description: Whether or not this mapping applies to creates, updates, or deletes.

create.description: Whether or not this mapping applies to create (POST) operations.

delete.description: Whether or not this mapping applies to DELETE operations.

update.description: Whether or not this mapping applies to update (PATCH/PUT) operations.

schema.description: Which SCIM resource type this mapping applies to.

transform_jsonata.description: A [JSONata](https://jsonata.org/) expression that transforms the resource before provisioning it in the application.

remote_uri.description: The base URI for the application's SCIM-compatible API.

allowed_idps.description: The identity providers your users can select when connecting to this application. Defaults to all IdPs configured in your account.

items.description: The identity providers selected for application.

app_launcher_visible.description: Displays the application in the App Launcher.

auto_redirect_to_identity.description: When set to `true`, users skip the identity provider selection step during login. You must specify only one identity provider in allowed_idps.

logo_url.description: The image URL for the logo shown in the App Launcher dashboard.

auth_type.description: Optional identifier indicating the authentication protocol used for the saas app. Required for OIDC. Default if unset is "saml"

consumer_service_url.description: The service provider's endpoint that is responsible for receiving and parsing a SAML assertion.

friendly_name.description: The SAML FriendlyName of the attribute.

name_format.description: A globally unique name for an identity or service provider.

required.description: If the attribute is required when building a SAML assertion.

name.description: The name of the IdP attribute.

name_by_idp.description: A mapping from IdP ID to attribute name.

idp_entity_id.description: The unique identifier for your SaaS application.

name_id_format.description: The format of the name identifier sent to the SaaS application.

name_id_transform_jsonata.description: A [JSONata](https://jsonata.org/) expression that transforms an application's user identities into a NameID value for its SAML assertion. This expression should evaluate to a singular string. The output of this expression can override the `name_id_format` setting.

public_key.description: The Access public certificate that will be used to verify your identity.

sp_entity_id.description: A globally unique name for an identity or service provider.

sso_endpoint.description: The endpoint where your SaaS application will send login requests.

access_token_lifetime.description: The lifetime of the OIDC Access Token after creation. Valid units are m,h. Must be greater than or equal to 1m and less than or equal to 24h.

allow_pkce_without_client_secret.description: If client secret should be required on the token endpoint when authorization_code_with_pkce grant is used.

app_launcher_url.description: The URL where this applications tile redirects users

auth_type.description: Identifier of the authentication protocol used for the saas app. Required for OIDC.

client_id.description: The application client id

client_secret.description: The application client secret, only returned on POST request.

required.description: If the claim is required when building an OIDC token.

name.description: The name of the IdP claim.

name_by_idp.description: A mapping from IdP ID to claim name.

grant_types.description: The OIDC flows supported by this application

group_filter_regex.description: A regex to filter Cloudflare groups returned in ID token and userinfo endpoint.

return_access_token_from_authorization_e.description: If an Access Token should be returned from the OIDC Authorization endpoint

return_id_token_from_authorization_endpo.description: If an ID Token should be returned from the OIDC Authorization endpoint

public_key.description: The Access public certificate that will be used to verify your identity.

redirect_uris.description: The permitted URL's for Cloudflare to return Authorization codes and Access/ID tokens

lifetime.description: How long a refresh token will be valid for after creation. Valid units are m,h,d. Must be longer than 1m.

scopes.description: Define the user information shared with access, "offline_access" scope will be automatically enabled if refresh tokens are enabled

service_auth_401_redirect.description: Returns a 401 status code when the request is blocked by a Service Auth policy.

session_duration.description: The amount of time that tokens issued for this application will be valid. Must be in the format `300ms` or `2h45m`. Valid time units are: ns, us (or Âµs), ms, s, m, h.
